qas.question: Hayek believed the state could aid the economy by doing what?
Who did Hayek say economic security should be guaranteed to?
According to Hayek, clothing, food and shelter should be provided to what extent?
What sort of system did Hayek propose the government create?

context: Hayek also wrote that the state can play a role in the economy, and specifically, in <a0_0>creating a "safety net"<a0_0/>. He wrote, "There is no reason why, in a society which has reached the general level of wealth ours has, the first kind of security should not be guaranteed to <a1_0>all<a1_0/> without endangering general freedom; that is: some minimum of food, shelter and clothing, <a2_0>sufficient to preserve health<a2_0/>. Nor is there any reason why the state should not help to organize a comprehensive system of <a3_0>social insurance<a3_0/> in providing for those common hazards of life against which few can make adequate provision."
